full_desc_with_verices.text: S. FRANKEL WOOLENS 3 WEST 29TH STREET NEW YORK 1, N. Y. MURRAY HILL 4-2717-2718 3 100/ Mr. Saul Weingort 51 Av. Des Alpes Montreux, Switzerland My dear Saul, March 25, 1946 ch. 1.4.46. Please excuse the fact that I am writing you in English but it is easier for me because I can dictate it to my secretary and it takes much less time. You know how busy I am. Believe, me, I even have no time to eat. This is also the reason why I did not write to your father-in-law. If there would have been a positive answer, I would have written him a long time ago but unfortunately our income is very low and I don't see how the Vaad Hatzala can give a bigger amount to the Yeshiva in Montreux. I might be able to push through a thousand or two thousand dollars, if it could help buy the building. I was very glad to receive your information that the four children have al- ready come to Aix Les Bains. Please write me their exact address as I want to send them some packages. Also, please write me what your further plans for them are and whether they are still religious. The reason I ask you this question is because I am wondering whether it would be advisable to bring these children to America. You know that in this country one has to be very careful, especially with girls who are not under the supervision of their parents. Therefore, I would like to know your opinion as to how you find them and whether I should do something about bringing them over here or whether it would be better for them to stay in Europe and get married there. I have still not had the time to check up about the money. I see one entry where you paid out to Mr. Shapiro on July 9, 1945, 1000 and I don't know whether this represents Swiss Francs or Dollars. On the other hand, I did send you, through the Vaad Hatzala, in August, 1945, $1000 to be paid out to Shapiro and you do not mention in your letter whether you received this money. I lost the address of Mata Klein and I would appreciate it if you would be able to send it to me immediately as I want to send her some further help and affidavits. My wife is sailing from Sweden March 26th and we expect her here, with G-d's help, April 8th. She is taking the two children with her and also, one child from Piotrkow which she found there. She was also working on bringing another 20 children. Let us hope she will succeed in this work. 11313 112 121 120 112222 My те 6021 Aj العلاد 56 11 9 13 22 21 11521 Pl yo 3en دام 1

words: Please excuse the fact that I am writing you in English but it is easier for
me because I can dictate it to my secretary and it takes much less time. You
know how busy I am. Believe, me, I even have no time to eat. This is also the
reason why I did not write to your father-in-law. If there would have been a
positive answer, I would have written him a long time ago but unfortunately
our income is very low and I don't see how the Vaad Hatzala can give a bigger
amount to the Yeshiva in Montreux. I might be able to push through a thousand
or two thousand dollars, if it could help buy the building.
I was very glad to receive your information that the four children have al-
ready come to Aix Les Bains. Please write me their exact address as I want to
send them some packages. Also, please write me what your further plans for
them are and whether they are still religious. The reason I ask you this
question is because I am wondering whether it would be advisable to bring
these children to America. You know that in this country one has to be very
careful, especially with girls who are not under the supervision of their
parents. Therefore, I would like to know your opinion as to how you find them
and whether I should do something about bringing them over here or whether it
would be better for them to stay in Europe and get married there.
I have still not had the time to check up about the money. I see one entry
where you paid out to Mr. Shapiro on July 9, 1945, 1000 and I don't know whether
this represents Swiss Francs or Dollars. On the other hand, I did send you,
through the Vaad Hatzala, in August, 1945, $1000 to be paid out to Shapiro
and you do not mention in your letter whether you received this money.
I lost the address of Mata Klein and I would appreciate it if you would be
able to send it to me immediately as I want to send her some further help
My wife is sailing from Sweden March 26th and we expect her here, with G-d's
help, April 8th. She is taking the two children with her and also, one child
from Piotrkow which she found there. She was also working on bringing another
20 children. Let us hope she will succeed in this work.
